page.title: 03Telscombe Cliffs History
page.content: Telscombe Cliffs is right on the coast south of the village from which it gets its name. Between the village and Telscombe Cliffs is a stretch of open Downland some of which is farmed. There is access between the village and Telscombe Cliffs by a dirt road. At the start of this is a short length of concrete road upon which there were two large guns during the Second World War,which one resident said could fire as far as France. The oldest area in Telscombe Cliffs is said to be The Warren, now called Warren Way- a small housing estate.The Warren estate is said to date back 800 years.There was a large manor house which was at one time a riding stables and then a night club. Between 1960 and 1965 the old house was demolished and the existing development took place. Kevin Gardner & N.Reeves age 9
